result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian M Lemens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs of the action. If not paid in full within 60 days, stay on additional 10 days of jail time will be lifted.

Consecutive to case no. 14-CM-226. 10 days of sentence are stayed. If Defendant pays costs in full on or before 10/20/15, stay will be permanent. If Defendant fails to pay costs in full on or before 10/20/15, stay will be lifted. Good time and Huber privileges granted. 60 days from sentencing date to report. Can be served in any count. Defendant is responsible for notifying Door County Jail if sentence is being served in different county.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Motion to consolidate appeals is granted.
of receipt of Notice of Appeal
Defendant called indicating he paid the fine/costs online on Monday, 10/19/15.
from Defense re: motion to stay

1:33 Defendant Brian M Lemens and Attorney Linda Schaefer not in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews sentences, letter from Defense requesting stay of sentence pending appeal, limited time that Defense is available. Court is prepared to proceed on motion without Defendant/Defense, particularly because Defense could not reach Defendant. Court reviews motion. State opposes motion, presents argument. Court makes statement, denies motion.

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Brian M Lemens
Current: 136 N. 3rd Ave, Apt. 2, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235 United States  (Effective: 08-25-2015)
Prior: 3821 Egg Harbor Road, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

Defendant Brian M Lemens in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. Court questions Defendant, who agrees with repeater status. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Discussion regarding negotiations, settlement offer, whether or not Defendant wants to actually enter plea. Defendant wants to accept plea, serve sentence in different county for work release. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Brian M Lemens in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests adjournment.  Status conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Brian M Lemens in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions Defendant, who thought hearing was tomorrow, started a new job at CJ Builders this morning. Defense advises of Defendant's wish to have files separated, but State does not want to do that. Defense advises that Defendant will be requesting PD representation on 14-CM-226, has not seen discovery. Defendant leaves to see PD.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Linda Jean Schaefer in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions why Defendant is not present. Atty Schaefer advises that she only represents him on this case, did not have anything to mail him. State requests bench warrant. Court orders warrant. Defense requests 24 hour stay. Court will grant until end of today.

Defendant Brian M Lemens in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. State advises of global offer that has been outstanding since early March. Defense advises that Defendant has wanted to have these cases handled separately, thinks he needs to have an attorney on the prior case, doesn't know how to proceed going forward. Court questions Defendant, who will be requesting attorney in earlier file. Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Brian M Lemens in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Schaefer requests that status be set to give time for her to file discovery demand.  Status conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant Brian M Lemens in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense enters not guilty plea. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to enter any bars or taverns. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Brian M Lemens appeared by video conference. Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers appeared by phone. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 3/9/15, 10:00.
